title: Where do I find rap music with substance? - Quora

response.answer_text: Although it does get increasingly difficult to do so in this day and age, it is possible with some time. What I like to do is find new artists through association with artists I already know. Here's a list of artists you're sure to come across: Kendrick Lamar Joey Bada$$ Chance The Rapper Denzel Curry J. Cole Earl Sweatshirt Ab-Soul Kanye West's earlier music Danny Brown (Only for the obscure proceed with caution) Noname (FKA Noname Gypsy) Saba Vic Mensa Respectable Rap Collectives: SaveMoney Pro Era Top Dawg Entertainment Odd Future P.S. check out DatPiff too, although most of it is trap garbage, if you're willing to look you'll find some gems. Remember to also look through your favorites' full discography to introduce yourself to artists that they have collaborated with

Try these albums:Phora- Still A KidPhora- Sincerly YoursMr. Lif- Don't Look DownUgly Heroes- Ugly HeroesUgly Heroes- Everything In BetweenSupastition- Chain LettersCunninLynguists- Strange Journey Dela Soul- Changes Of AtmosphereMurs & 9th Wonder- Murs For PresidentMurs & 9th Wonder- Sweet LordY Society- At Your Own PacePete Rock & INI- Center Of AttentionMasta Ace- The Falling SeasonClear Soul Forces- Gold PP7sTragic Allies- The Tree of Knowledge of Good And EvilCormega- Mega Philosophy Koss & A.G- Natural High You should check UndergroundHipHop.com for more album and of course there are many ways you can get albums that appear on that site.
